music

Class MusicLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • music.MusicLibrary

  • public class MusicLibrary
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MusicLibrary() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAlbum(java.lang.String fileName)
      Adds a new album to our catalog.
      void displayByAlbums()
      Sorts our catalog by albums, and displays the catalog by albums first by iterating over the sorted catalog.
      void displayByArtists()
      Sorts our catalog by artists, and displays the catalog by artists first by iterating over the sorted catalog.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void promptMenu()
      The menu for our music library.
      void readFile()
      Simply reads our file.
      void searchByAlbum()
      Searches our music catalog for a specific artist using binary search.
      void searchByArtist()
      Searches our music catalog for a specific artist using binary search (plus a little extra).

    • Constructor Detail

      • MusicLibrary

        public MusicLibrary()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • readFile

        public void readFile()
        Simply reads our file. Dissects the file line by line, parsing the necessary information from it. Then, creates an album object from each line. Also sorts the tracks in alphabetical order immediately once gotten.

      • promptMenu

        public void promptMenu()
        The menu for our music library. It has several options. This menu is recursive: once we carry out an option, the menu is prompted again. This is my favorite method.

      • searchByAlbum

        public void searchByAlbum()
        Searches our music catalog for a specific artist using binary search.

      • searchByArtist

        public void searchByArtist()
        Searches our music catalog for a specific artist using binary search (plus a little extra).

      • addAlbum

        public void addAlbum(java.lang.String fileName)
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Adds a new album to our catalog. Also appends it to the actual .txt file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name of the file we want to append the info to
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file name does not exist

      • displayByAlbums

        public void displayByAlbums()
        Sorts our catalog by albums, and displays the catalog by albums first by iterating over the sorted catalog.

      • displayByArtists

        public void displayByArtists()
        Sorts our catalog by artists, and displays the catalog by artists first by iterating over the sorted catalog.
